left.name: program_id
left.description: Unique identifier of the ARGO program.

meta.notes: This is the unique id that is assigned to your program.  If you have logged into the platform, this is the Program Id that you see in the Submission area. For example, PACA-CA is a Program ID.

right.name: program_id
right.description: Unique identifier of the ARGO program.

meta.notes: This is the unique id that is assigned to your program.  If you have logged into the platform, this is the Program Id that you see in the Submiission area.

notes.data: This is the unique id that is assigned to your program.  If you have logged into the platform, this is the Program Id that you see in the Submiission area.

left.name: primary_site
left.description: The text term used to describe the primary site of disease, as categorized by the World Health Organization's (WHO) International Classification of Diseases for Oncology (ICD-O). This categorization groups cases into general categories.

codeList: Bones, joints and articular cartilage of limbs
Bones, joints and articular cartilage of other and unspecified sites
Connective, subcutaneous and other soft tissues
Other and ill-defined sites in lip, oral cavity and pharynx
Other and ill-defined sites within respiratory system and intrathoracic organs
Other and unspecified female genital organs
Other and unspecified major salivary glands
Other and unspecified male genital organs
Other and unspecified parts of biliary tract
Other and unspecified parts of mouth
Other and unspecified parts of tongue
Other endocrine glands and related structures
Peripheral nerves and autonomic nervous system
Spinal cord, cranial nerves, and other parts of central nervous system

data.name: primary_site
data.description: The text term used to describe the primary site of disease, as categorized by the World Health Organization's (WHO) International Classification of Diseases for Oncology (ICD-O). This categorization groups cases into general categories.

codeList: Bones, joints and articular cartilage of limbs

left.name: submitter_primary_diagnosis_id
left.description: Indicate the primary diagnosis event in the clinical timeline that this specimen aquisition was related to.

data.name: submitter_primary_diagnosis_id
data.description: Indicate the primary diagnosis event in the clinical timeline that this specimen aquisition was related to.

left.name: pathological_tumour_staging_system
left.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to assess the cancer at the time the tumour specimen was resected. Pathological classification is based on the clinical stage information (acquired before treatment) and supplemented/modified by operative findings and pathological evaluation of the resected specimen.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

right.name: pathological_tumour_staging_system
right.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to assess the cancer at the time the tumour specimen was resected. Pathological classification is based on the clinical stage information (acquired before treatment) and supplemented/modified by operative findings and pathological evaluation of the resected specimen.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

left.name: specimen_acquisition_interval
left.description: Interval between primary diagnosis and specimen acquisition, in days.

meta.notes: The associated Primary Diagnosis is used as the reference point for this interval. To calculate this, find the number of days since the date of primary diagnosis.

right.name: specimen_acquisition_interval
right.description: Interval between primary diagnosis and specimen acquisition, in days.

restrictions.notes: The associated Primary Diagnosis is used as the reference point for this interval. To calculate this, find the number of days since the date of primary diagnosis.

notes.data: The associated Primary Diagnosis is used as the reference point for this interval. To calculate this, find the number of days since the date of primary diagnosis.
The associated Primary Diagnosis is used as the reference point for this interval. To calculate this, find the number of days since the date of primary diagnosis.

left.name: specimen_anatomic_location
left.description: Anatomic location of a specimen when it was collected.

right.name: specimen_anatomic_location
right.description: Anatomic location of a specimen when it was collected.

left.name: specimen_processing
left.description: Indicate the technique used to process specimen.

codeList: Cryopreservation of live cells in liquid nitrogen

right.name: specimen_processing
right.description: Indicate the technique used to process specimen.

codeList: Cryopreservation of live cells in liquid nitrogen

left.name: specimen_storage
left.description: Indicate the method of specimen storage for specimens that were not extracted freshly or immediately cultured.

meta.notes: For specimens that were freshly extracted or immediately cultured, select Not Applicable.

right.name: specimen_storage
right.description: Indicate the method of specimen storage for specimens that were not extracted freshly or immediately cultured.

meta.notes: For specimens that were freshly extracted or immediately cultured, select Not Applicable.

left.name: tumour_grading_system
left.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to assess the description of a tumour based on how abnormal the tumour cells and the tumour tissue look under a microscope. Tumour grade is an indicator of how quickly a tumour is likely to grow.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

codeList: WHO grading system for CNS tumours

right.name: tumour_grading_system
right.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to assess the description of a tumour based on how abnormal the tumour cells and the tumour tissue look under a microscope. Tumour grade is an indicator of how quickly a tumour is likely to grow.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

deleted: WHO grading system for CNS tumours

left.name: tumour_grade
left.description: Grade of the tumour as assigned by the reporting tumour_grading_system.

meta.notes: This field depends on the selected tumour grading system, and is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

right.name: tumour_grade
right.description: Grade of the tumour as assigned by the reporting tumour_grading_system.

meta.notes: This field depends on the selected tumour grading system, and is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

left.name: treatment_type
left.description: Indicate the type of treatment regimen that the donor completed.

meta.notes: Depending on the treatment_type selected, additional treament details may be required to be submitted.  Depending on the treatment_type selected, additional treatment details may be required to be submitted. For example, if treatment_type includes 'Chemotherapy', the supplemental Chemotherapy treatment type file is required.

left.name: treatment_start_interval
left.description: The interval between primary diagnosis and initiation of treatment, in days.

meta.notes: The associated Primary Diagnosis is used as the reference point for this interval. To calculate this, find the number of days since the date of primary diagnosis.

left.description: Indicate the method(s) used to confirm the donor's progression disease status. (Codelist reference: NCI CDE ID: 6161031)
left.name: method_of_progression_status

codeList: Biomarker in liquid biopsy (e.g. tumour marker in blood or urine)

meta.notes: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates progression or relapse

right.description: Indicate the method(s) used to confirm the donor's progression disease status. (Codelist reference: NCI CDE ID: 6161031)
right.name: method_of_progression_status

codeList: Biomarker in liquid biopsy (e.g. tumour marker in blood or urine)

meta.notes: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates progression or relapse

left.description: Indicate the anatomic site where disease progression or recurrence occurred. (Codelist reference: NCI CDE ID: 4742851)
left.name: anatomic_site_progression_or_recurrences

meta.notes: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates progression or relapse.

right.description: Indicate the anatomic site where disease progression or recurrence occurred. (Codelist reference: NCI CDE ID: 4742851)
right.name: anatomic_site_progression_or_recurrences

meta.notes: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates progression or relapse.

left.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to stage the cancer at time of retreatment for recurrence or disease progression. This may be represented as rTNM in the medical report.
left.name: recurrence_tumour_staging_system

meta.notes: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates progression or relapse.

right.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to stage the cancer at time of retreatment for recurrence or disease progression. This may be represented as rTNM in the medical report.
right.name: recurrence_tumour_staging_system

meta.notes: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates progression or relapse.

left.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to stage the cancer after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery. This may be represented as ypTNM or ycTNM in the medical report.
left.name: posttherapy_tumour_staging_system

right.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to stage the cancer after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery. This may be represented as ypTNM or ycTNM in the medical report.
right.name: posttherapy_tumour_staging_system

left.name: posttherapy_stage_group
left.description: The code to represent the stage group of the tumour, as assigned by the reporting posttherapy_tumour_staging_system, that indicates the overall prognostic tumour stage (ie. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III etc.) after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected posttherapy_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

right.name: posttherapy_stage_group
right.description: The code to represent the stage group of the tumour, as assigned by the reporting posttherapy_tumour_staging_system, that indicates the overall prognostic tumour stage (ie. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III etc.) after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery.

meta.notes: This field value is dependent on the selected posttherapy_tumour_staging_system.

notes.data: This field value is dependent on the selected posttherapy_tumour_staging_system.

right.name: chemotherapy_drug_name

meta.notes: This field uses a controlled vocabulary gathered from the DrugBank database of drug names.
